[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Social Media Platform (SMP) enables users to create accounts, share posts, connect with others, and control privacy.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: SMP supports user registration, content sharing, interactions, notifications, and privacy management.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: SMP integrates with third-party services like Google, Facebook, and other social platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: SMP provides web and mobile UI for seamless access.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: SMP supports desktops, tablets, and smartphones.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: SMP uses REST APIs for integrations and data management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: SMP provides notifications via email and in-app messaging.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: SMP optimizes storage for user profiles, posts, media, and notifications.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: SMP supports user registration, account management, interactions, and content sharing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: SMP customizes feeds and notifications based on preferences.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: SMP connects with APIs for post sharing, messaging, and recommendations.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: SMP enables account management, post creation, interactions, notifications, and privacy control.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: SMP serves users, content creators, advertisers, and administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: SMP requires internet access for interactions, features, and notifications.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: SMP depends on third-party authentication services and secure databases.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall allow users to create an account via email, phone, or third-party authentication via Google, Facebook, and connect with others by username or email.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support content sharing through social media and messaging apps.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to TO-BE-DEFINED (REQ-INTF-001, REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall allow users to view, react to posts, and receive notifications on interactions like friend requests, comments, likes (REQ-INTF-002, REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall allow users to manage post and profile privacy, including blocking/reporting users (REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI for account creation, post management, and interaction.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall allow easy navigation through posts, requests, notifications, and settings.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall provide real-time updates on interactions and notifications within 1 second.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store user data, posts, interaction history, and privacy settings in a secure database.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall ensure secure user authentication and data storage, protecting privacy.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with data protection regulations such as GDPR.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure encrypted communication and secure data storage.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests validate account creation, post interactions, notifications, and privacy settings.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and compliance guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Social media best practices, data protection regulations, and user experience standards.
